meanings.definition: To cry louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outbawled her friend when she fell and scraped her knee.
meanings.sent2: The baby outbawled all the other children in the daycare.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor outbawled the audience with his emotional performance.
meanings.sent4: The thunder outbawled the sound of the pouring rain.
meanings.sent5: Her outbawling sobs echoed through the empty hallway.

meanings.definition: To shout or yell louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He outbawled his teammates to make sure his voice was heard during the game.
meanings.sent2: The coach outbawled the referee in disagreement with the call.
meanings.sent3: The parrot outbawled the noisy children in the park with its loud squawking.
meanings.sent4: The protesters outbawled the speaker, demanding to be heard.
meanings.sent5: His outbawled cries for help pierced through the chaos of the crowded street.
